Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that a federal judge ordered Wisconsin to have all ballots counted by 8 p.m. on the day of the election, which is not true.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that voters in line at 8 p.m. on Election Day can legally cast their vote, so it is impossible for all votes to be counted by 8 p.m.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or name of the judge who allegedly made the ruling.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all ballots can be counted by 8 p.m., which is not feasible considering the time it takes to process and count the ballots.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the actual ruling from a federal judge, which allows absentee ballots returned by Nov. 9 to be counted if postmarked by Election Day.
